subject: Re: [junit] Test Everything, No Matter How Simple
msgSnippet: ... I m not sure 100% code coverage is a necessary condition to use this technique. I m not sure the two are more than tangentially related. I don t know
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

> > So you're recommending 100% code coverage?
>
> Yes. More specifically in this article, I'm recommending that when you
> find a bug, you write a test for it first, even if the fix is obvious.

I'm not sure 100% code coverage is a necessary condition to use this
technique. I'm not sure the two are more than tangentially related. I
don't know whether that matters.

I can't encourage the technique enough, though. That much is obvious to me.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
